articles.author: Benj Edwards
articles.title: Catastrophic AI harms among warnings in declaration signed by 28 nations | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Bletchley Declaration sums up first day of UKs international AI Safety Summit.
articles.content: Enlarge/ UK Technology Secretary Michelle Donelan (front row center) is joined by international counterparts for a group photo at the AI Safety Summit at Bletchley Park in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamsh [+4445 chars]
articles.summary: The UK hosted an AI Safety Summit attended by countries including the US and China. The event included the signing of The Bletchley Declaration which warns of potential harm from advanced AI and calls for international cooperation to ensure responsible AI deployment. There is potential for serious even catastrophic harm either deliberate or unintentional stemming from the most significant capabilities of these AI models reads the declaration. The summit began an international dialogue on AI safety it stopped short of setting specific policy goals. There remains a lack of consensus on what global AI regulations should entail or who should be responsible for drafting them.
articles.html_summary:
• The UK hosted an AI Safety Summit attended by countries including the US and China.
  • The event included the signing of The Bletchley Declaration which warns of potential harm from advanced AI and calls for international cooperation to ensure responsible AI deployment.
  • There is potential for serious even catastrophic harm either deliberate or unintentional stemming from the most significant capabilities of these AI models reads the declaration.
  • The summit began an international dialogue on AI safety it stopped short of setting specific policy goals.
  • There remains a lack of consensus on what global AI regulations should entail or who should be responsible for drafting them.

articles.author: Kyle Orland
articles.title: Why Capcom thinks PC game modding is akin to cheating | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Japanese publisher cites reputational damage, support costs of unauthorized mods.
articles.content: 46 with For most PC gamers, the ability to update their game with a wide variety of mods is a huge benefit they can claim over most (but not all) console players. But Japanese publisher Capcom (Res [+3316 chars]
articles.summary: Japanese publisher Capcom Resident Evil Street Fighter says it sees unauthorized modding of PC games as a problem akin to cheating. That s according to a minute presentation covering anti cheat and anti piracy measures in PC gaming that was posted to the Capcom R D YouTube channel last week and noticed recently by GamesRadar. The presentation describes modding as an inseparable part of PC gaming and a reflection of a PC platform that lets you do anything you want compared to the game console. But in practically the same breath Capcom goes on to say that what the mods are doing is no different than cheating.
articles.html_summary:
• Japanese publisher Capcom Resident Evil Street Fighter says it sees unauthorized modding of PC games as a problem akin to cheating.
  • That s according to a minute presentation covering anti cheat and anti piracy measures in PC gaming that was posted to the Capcom R D YouTube channel last week and noticed recently by GamesRadar.
  • The presentation describes modding as an inseparable part of PC gaming and a reflection of a PC platform that lets you do anything you want compared to the game console.
  • But in practically the same breath Capcom goes on to say that what the mods are doing is no different than cheating.

articles.author: Jonathan M. Gitlin
articles.title: Almostunbeatable AI is now a permanent feature of Gran Turismo 7 | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: The Sophy AI can now drive 340 cars and nine tracks in the game after update 1.40.
articles.content: 7 with Competent AI opponents are the key to a good singleplayer racing game. And with this weeks update, Gran Turismo 7 is getting an AI upgrade as Sony rolls out its Sophy AI agent as a permane [+3771 chars]
articles.summary: Gran Turismo is getting an AI upgrade as Sony rolls out its Sophy AI agent as a permanent feature of the game. The entertainment company experimented with it earlier this year for a few weeks in a limited test but when the GT Spec II update rolls out to consoles tomorrow morning Sophy will be able to race the game s cars on nine of its tracks. The update also adds seven new cars including the Lexus LFA Mercedes Benz E Evo II the latest Porsche GT RS and the Tesla Model.
articles.html_summary:
• Gran Turismo is getting an AI upgrade as Sony rolls out its Sophy AI agent as a permanent feature of the game.
  • The entertainment company experimented with it earlier this year for a few weeks in a limited test but when the GT Spec II update rolls out to consoles tomorrow morning Sophy will be able to race the game s cars on nine of its tracks.
  • The update also adds seven new cars including the Lexus LFA Mercedes Benz E Evo II the latest Porsche GT RS and the Tesla Model.

articles.author: Benj Edwards
articles.title: Inserted AIgenerated Microsoft poll about womans death rankles The Guardian | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Speculative AI news poll presented three choices Murder, accident, or suicide.
articles.content: 15 with On Tuesday, The Guardian accused Microsoft of damaging its journalistic reputation by publishing an AIgenerated poll beside one of its articles on the Microsoft Start website. The poll, cr [+2589 chars]
articles.summary: The Guardian accused Microsoft of damaging its journalistic reputation by publishing an AI generated poll beside one of its articles on the Microsoft Start website. The poll created by an AI model on Microsoft s news platform speculated on the cause of a woman s death reportedly triggering reader anger and leading to reputational concerns for the news organization. The Guardian has a licensing agreement with Microsoft that allows the tech company to publish the newspaper s articles on Microsoft Start which serves as a news aggregation website and app. Following negative reactions the poll was removed but critical comments remained visible for a time before their removal.
articles.html_summary:
• The Guardian accused Microsoft of damaging its journalistic reputation by publishing an AI generated poll beside one of its articles on the Microsoft Start website.
  • The poll created by an AI model on Microsoft s news platform speculated on the cause of a woman s death reportedly triggering reader anger and leading to reputational concerns for the news organization.
  • The Guardian has a licensing agreement with Microsoft that allows the tech company to publish the newspaper s articles on Microsoft Start which serves as a news aggregation website and app.
  • Following negative reactions the poll was removed but critical comments remained visible for a time before their removal.

articles.author: By KELVIN CHAN - AP Business Writer
articles.title: Cuttingedge AI raises fears about risks to humanity. Are tech and political leaders doing enough? | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Chatbots like ChatGPT wowed with their ability to do tasks as good as or better than humans, thanks to cuttingedge artificial intelligence systems. Now, frontier AI has become the latest buzzword as concerns grow that the emerging technology has capabilities
articles.content: By KELVIN CHAN  AP Business WriterLONDON (AP) Chatbots like ChatGPT wowed the world with their ability to write speeches, plan vacations or hold a conversation as good as or arguably even better t [+7216 chars]
articles.summary: Its reportedly expected to be draw a group of about 100 officials from 28 countries, including U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris and executives from key U.S. artificial intelligence companies including OpenAI, Googles DeepMind and Anthropic. British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will host a two-day summit focused on frontier AI. Its reportedly expected to draw a group of about 100 officials from 28 countries, including U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and executives from key U.S. artificial intelligence companies including OpenAI, Googles Deepmind and Anthropic. And so Im not surprised that its also making its way into what they might be saying to U.K. officials. Tech companies shouldnt be involved in drafting regulations because they tend to underestimate or downplay the urgency and full range of harms, Raji said. In a speech last week, Sunak said only governments  not AI companies  can keep people safe from the technologys risks. Theyre based on foundation models, which are algorithms trained on a broad range of information scraped from the internet to provide a general, but not infallible, base of knowledge.That makes frontier AI systems dangerous because theyre not perfectly knowledgeable, Clune said. (Peter Nicholls/Pool via AP, File)LONDON (AP)  Chatbots like ChatGPT wowed the world with their ability to write speeches, plan vacations or hold a conversation as good as or arguably even better than humans do, thanks to cutting-edge artificial intelligence systems.

• It’s reportedly expected to be draw a group of about 100 officials from 28 countries, including U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris and executives from key U.S. artificial intelligence companies including OpenAI, Google’s DeepMind and Anthropic..
  • British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will host a two-day summit focused on frontier AI..
  • It’s reportedly expected to draw a group of about 100 officials from 28 countries, including U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and executives from key U.S. artificial intelligence companies including OpenAI, Google’s Deepmind and Anthropic..

  • In a speech last week, Sunak said only governments — not AI companies — can keep people safe from the technology’s risks..

articles.author: Steve Hasker
articles.title: How AI is enhancing, not threatening the future of professionals | TechCrunch | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Driven by the notion of AI as a competitor, fear of job displacement still looms in some corners of the professional world.
articles.content: The widespread influence of artificial intelligence (AI) on nearly every facet of our lives is undeniable. Its rapid expansion has prompted us to reflect on how it can redefine the roles of professio [+2462 chars]
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has the potential to redefine the roles of professionals across industries. Professionals agree on AI s potential to enhance productivity and efficiency. The application of AI is expected to address operational challenges and reshape work processes. In the legal industry in particular this enthusiasm for productivity improvement is divided between law firms and in house legal departments. Many respondents said they do not yet have complete confidence in the accuracy of its outputs. This further underscores the need for a human preferably one with experience and industry knowledge to remain involved in the process.
articles.html_summary:
• Artificial intelligence has the potential to redefine the roles of professionals across industries.
  • Professionals agree on AI s potential to enhance productivity and efficiency.
  • The application of AI is expected to address operational challenges and reshape work processes.
  • In the legal industry in particular this enthusiasm for productivity improvement is divided between law firms and in house legal departments.
  • Many respondents said they do not yet have complete confidence in the accuracy of its outputs.
  • This further underscores the need for a human preferably one with experience and industry knowledge to remain involved in the process.

articles.author: Andrew Cunningham
articles.title: Its the end of the line for the 13inch MacBook Pro (and the Touch Bar) | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: The M2 MacBook Pro was the last gasp of 2016era MacBook design.
articles.content: Enlarge/ Apples 13inch MacBook Pro, gone but not forgotten.0 with NEW YORKApple refreshed its MacBook Pro lineup earlier today, and there was one surprise that the rumor mill hadnt anticipated [+2539 chars]
articles.summary: Apple introduced a new base model of the inch MacBook Pro with a plain old M chip in it starting at $999. The Pro includes many features that were never included in the inch Pro including the larger high refresh rate ProMotion display. Apple also now sells a inch MacBook Air at that starting point giving people another option in between the mainstream inch Air and the Pro lineup. Apple is said to be working on touchscreen Macs though this would run counter to over a decade of vociferous public objection to the very idea of touchscreens in computers.
articles.html_summary:
• Apple introduced a new base model of the inch MacBook Pro with a plain old M chip in it starting at $999.
  • The Pro includes many features that were never included in the inch Pro including the larger high refresh rate ProMotion display.
  • Apple also now sells a inch MacBook Air at that starting point giving people another option in between the mainstream inch Air and the Pro lineup.
  • Apple is said to be working on touchscreen Macs though this would run counter to over a decade of vociferous public objection to the very idea of touchscreens in computers.

articles.title: New 14 and 16inch MacBook Pros add M3 chips, plus a $1,599 entrylevel model | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: The exterior is mostly the same, but theres a new lowend option in town.
articles.content: 7 with  Apple leans into its events spooky vibes with the new space black version of the MacBook Pro.  The exterior design remains largely unchanged from the prev [+5461 chars]
articles.summary: Apple has launched a newly refreshed lineup of and inch MacBook Pros at its Scary Fast product event this evening. Apple is replacing not just the last generation versions of those laptops but also the old inch MacBook Pro. The M MacBook Pro is cheaper than the M Pro M Pro version of the laptop and it still uses the larger high refresh rate ProMotion display. Apple also quotes up to hours of battery life for the M version compared to up to for M Pro and Max versions. The new MacBook Pros are all available for preorder today and will be available starting November.
